text:
Hello Superpath community!

We have a new "Dear Superpath" question. This is a way for folks to ask anonymous questions. 

Career stage: junior (1-3 years of experience)

"Seeking advice on how to develop writing samples that will be attractive to content marketers and content marketing managers in industries such as B2B, Saas, tech startups. I am willing to volunteer or work pro bono and I've found some volunteer writing opportunities on platforms like: <https://www.catchafire.org/> or <https://www.taprootplus.org/>. Most opportunities in the platforms are for nonprofits and social causes. Do industry marketing managers see the types of writing experiences based on these platforms as valid experience for industry content marketing writing? If not, what would you recommend to develop clips and writing samples for industry when you are starting out with little to no industry experience but have writing ability, research skills, basic SEO knowledge and a willingness to learn?"

I can't speak to the samples question, but as far as how to get started, what worked for me was that I began as a researcher for an agency. I'd do article research and light outlining/organizing of research for different blog content. 

I did this for about 9 months and then I asked about trying out writing. Since then, I've eased into writing for four of her clients. She mostly works with enterprise B2B tech and SMB that are on the higher budget side. That's allowed me to create a pretty solid/robust portfolio. 

Some of it has also been following where and what I can get. At the end of 2020/beginning of '21, I ended up writing a stupid amount of articles on 5G, CNC machines, and ERP (across multiple clients). I ended up then with a tech manufacturing-ish niche area that I was very familiar with. 

Hope this helps. I'm typing from my phone so apologies for typos, etc!
